title: Home brands help save Coles' sale streak
text:
Steve Cain is pushing on own-brand products to drive growth in Coles' supermarket business.

Coles Group’s lowest quarterly sales result in 12 years is actually a pretty handy result for chief executive Steve Cain.

Coles blew the competition away in the September quarter of 2018 with its famous (or infamous in my house) Little Shop promotion of miniature collectibles driving like-for-like sales growth of 5.1 per cent.

Steve Cain is pushing hard to increase penetration of home brands. David Rowe

Cain was never going to replicate that, even with Little Shop 2 being rolled out for the September quarter of this year (yes, the little terrors at my place won that battle too, and we completed the set).

But sales growth of 0.1 per cent for the September quarter of 2019 is very respectable indeed, given analysts had tipped like-for-like sales could fall by as much as 1.5 per cent.

It also helped keep Coles’ record of 48 consecutive quarters of sales growth intact.
description: How home brand pasta sauce helped Coles maintain its record of 48 consecutive quarters of sales growth.
